podcasts.name: The GaryVee Audio Experience
podcasts.short: Keynote speeches on marketing and business, interviews, and fireside chats by Gary Vaynerchuck are blended with his current thoughts for an engaging audio experience

podcasts.name: a16z podcast
podcasts.short: Produced by a Silicon Valley based venture capital firm, you can hear about tech and culture trends, news, and about how ‘software eats the world’ right from industry experts and business leaders

podcasts.name: Entrepreneurs on Fire
podcasts.short: An award-winning podcast where the host & the founder ‘John Lee Dumas’ interviews inspiring entrepreneurs to help you along your entrepreneurial journey!

podcasts.name: The Tim Ferris Show
podcasts.short: Produced by a self-experimenter and bestselling author, Tim Ferriss deconstructs world-class professionals from diverse areas digging deep to find tools, tactics, and tricks we can use

podcasts.name: HBR Ideacast
podcasts.short: Weekly show hosted by Sarah Green Carmichael featuring lively interviews with industry professionals, scientists and journalists—some famous, others more behind the scenes—covering one general topic or issue per episode

podcasts.name: How I Built This
podcasts.short: Guy Raz dives into the stories behind some of the world's best-known companies. How I Built This weaves a narrative journey about innovators, entrepreneurs and idealists—and the movements they built.

videos.name: Startup Grind
videos.short: Startup grind is the world's largest community of startups, entrepreneurs, creators, and leaders. They dole out their expert advice to anyone who wants to learn and lead from the front

videos.name: Ted Talks
videos.short: Ranging from real life experiences to the latest in almost every professional and non professional field, Ted Talks inspire people to be creative and be the change they want to see in the world

videos.name: How to Evaluate Startup Ideas
videos.short: From searching for a problem worth solving to finding a feasible solution—a startup idea is born, and this process of analyzing startup ideas is what Kevin Hale elucidates in his videos

videos.name: Backstage with Millionaires
videos.short: The idea behind this initiative from Prithvi and Caleb is to share interesting, entertaining, and educational content about entrepreneurship and starting up businesses, with a focus on India's startup ecosystem

videos.name: Stanford Business
videos.short: Stanford Business gives the best business tips for budding entrepreneurs and professionals to manage their ventures. Learn right from qualified experts in the industry as they give sound advice on how to excel in business management

videos.name: Hubspot
videos.short: Hubspot is an ecosystem uniting software and community to help businesses grow better every day. It was founded 'inbound'—the notion that people don't want to be interrupted by marketers or harassed by salespeople, but want to be helped

videos.name: Google Small Business
videos.short: Get tips and tricks from the best in the tech world on how to effectively run, manage, and lead your small businesses bymaking proper use of the availbale resources and tools, often provided by GOogle themselves

newsletter.name: Harvard Business Review
newsletter.short: Published six times a year, this magazine on general management provides insightful advice about how to effectively run and manage your start-up projects

newsletter.name: YourStory
newsletter.short: YourStory is India's biggest source of start-up news, stories, and inspiring advice from the biggest and most successful entrepreneurs from diverse disciplines

newsletter.name: A Junior VC
newsletter.short: From talks with budding venture capitalists to encouraging more entrepreners to realise their dreams in the global arena, A Junior VC is the right place for your start-up round-up

blogs.name: 500 startups
blogs.short: 500 Startups is an early-stage venture fund and seed accelerator founded in 2010 by Dave McClure and Christine Tsai. It is a global venture capital firm with a network of startup programs for founders, mentors, and investors

blogs.name: Seth Godin's Blog
blogs.short: Seth Godin breaks the rules, doing things his own way, and making sure the ideas he share are in the spotlight making his blog quite addictive especially to first-time readers

blogs.name: Mixergy
blogs.short: The Mixergy Mission introduces you to doers and thinkers whose ideas and stories are so powerful that just hearing them will change you. Mixergy is a place where successful people teach ambitious upstarts

blogs.name: Brian Solis
blogs.short: Brian Solis is a globally recognized independent digital analyst, anthropologist, award-winning author, prominent blogger/writer, and world renowned keynote speaker and also hosts (r)evolution, a popular online video series that examines technology, trends and best practices

blogs.name: startups.com
blogs.short: startups.com’s mission is to help bring more Founders and startups into existence by providing education and tools to walk aspiring Founders through the entire startup process

blogs.name: Under 30 Blog
blogs.short: This informative blog deals with topics ranging from startup management to entrepreneurship ideas, advertisements, marketing, and running a successful business. It is a must read for any budding entrepreneur.

webseries.name: TVF Pitchers
webseries.short: Four budding entrepreneurs found a start-up only to realise that this has been what their life is all about—they were not destined for regular jobs. It also documents their subsequent journey to success

webseries.name: Shark Tank
webseries.short: Primarily for entertainment, this television show will keep you hooked to it with the contestant's wild ideas and creative ventures which they hope to turn into reality with corporate support

webseries.name: Silicon Valley
webseries.short: Sprinked with humour, this web series takes you on a virtual tour of the Silicon Valley start-up ecosystem and the challenges every small company faces in the rat-race to success

events.name: Collision
events.short: Dubbed as the Olympics of Tech, Collision is one of the world's largest technical conferneces. Startups from around the world, led by their founders and members mingle with top compnaies and professionals from almost every technical field to make this grand event happen.

events.name: Techstars Startup Weekend
events.short: Startup Weekend is a three-day program where aspiring entrepreneurs can experience startup life. Spanning hundreds of cities around the world, they work with leading organizations to support entrepreneurs and help them turn ideas into reality
